name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 10, schools in Nanjing suddenly announced that Xinhua Bookstore urgently recalled the eighth-grade physics textbook (volume 1), and "the authorities" required that no copies be circulated. The specific reason for the recall of the textbook is currently unknown. Some parents pointed out that it was a typo, but some netizens believed that minor errors would not result in a recall.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On the evening of September 11, all aircraft were suspended from taking off and landing due to the intrusion of drones over Tianjin Binhai Airport, causing all arriving flights to make alternate landings at Beijing Daxing Airport.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 11, the Human Rights Centre at the University of Galway in Ireland unveiled a bronze statue commemorating the late Nobel Peace Prize winner Liu Xiaobo.

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: On September 11, a blogger claimed that Gong Fangbin, a retired former major colonel of the People's Liberation Army and professor at the National Defense University, was given an internal party warning by the Beijing Municipal Commission for Discipline Inspection for publicly making erroneous remarks such as "Russia will definitely lose" and "Ukraine will definitely win."

name: 李老师不是你老师
content: Netizens added that after the Anhui Communist Youth League official account removed the "Youth Great Learning" entrance, it launched a new entrance called "Learning Exchange". Judging from the current design, "Learning Exchange" is a bit like a copy of the "Learning Power Country" platform.
